intro: Astracantha erinacea, commonly known as the hairy cactus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its spiny, cylindrical stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its leaves are reduced to spines, and it stores water in its fleshy stems, adapting to arid environments. Astracantha erinacea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
